deprecation.message: GroupDocs.Annotation API has been moved to a new package "GroupDocs.Annotation" with new & improved feature set.

description:
GroupDocs.Annotation for .NET is a flexible library that allows you to add document & image annotation capability to your web or mobile applications. Based on HTML5 technology, GroupDocs.Annotation library supports more than 45 file formats, allowing end users to annotate documents and images of just about any common business format, including PDF and Microsoft Word documents, Excel spreadsheets, PowerPoint presentations, Visio diagrams, TIFF, JPEG, PNG images and many more. Key benefits include:

1. GroupDocs.Annotation for .NET Library converts documents to HTML5 - a combination of HTML, CSS and SVG. This enables you to render documents as real text files and allows end users to select, mark up, strike out, copy to clipboard and search for text in any uploaded text document without having to install original software that the documents were created with.

2. No client-side installation required. Users can view and annotate any document from any device that has a web-browser with HTML5 support. So, no need for Acrobat Reader, for example, when annotating PDF documents.

3. GroupDocs.Annotation for .NET Library comes with a comprehensive set of commenting tools, which allow end users to highlight, strikethrough, mark up text within a document, draw freehand lines, add sticky notes and comment on images. Annotated documents can be printed, exported to PDF and downloaded right from your web app.

4. Support for more than 45 file formats! With a single DLL, you can provide your app's users with the capability to annotate the following types of documents:

Portable Document Format: PDF
Microsoft Word: DOC, DOCX, DOCM, DOT, DOTX, DOTM
Microsoft Excel: XLS, XLSX, XLSM, XLSB, XML
Microsoft PowerPoint: PPT, PPTX
Microsoft Visio: VSD, VDX, VSS, VSX, VST, VTX, VSDX, VDW
Microsoft Project: MPP, MPT
Microsoft Outlook: MSG, EML
OpenDocument Formats: ODT, OTT, ODS, ODP
Rich Text Format: RTF
Plain Text File: TXT
Comma-Separated Values: CSV
HyperText Markup Language: HTM, HTML, MHT, MHTML
XML Paper Specification: XPS
AutoCAD Drawing File Format: DXF
Image files: BMP, GIF, JPG, PNG, TIFF
Electronic publication: EPUB

For more details on the GroupDocs.Annotation for .NET Library, please visit our website: 
http://groupdocs.com/dot-net/document-annotation-library

Note: this download contains a fully working version of the product, however without a license set it will run in evaluation mode with some limitations. To test GroupDocs.Annotation for .NET Library without evaluation limitations, request a free 30-day temporary license.
releaseNotes:
Features implemented:

[ANNOTATION-570] Annotation.NET - Hide UI controls depending on permissions set
[ANNOTATION-568] Annotation.NET - Get rid of redundant references
[ANNOTATION-591] Annotation.NET - Text replacement tool
[ANNOTATION-592] Annotation.NET - Text removal mode for the strikeout tool
[ANNOTATION-594] Annotation.NET - An option to download exported annotations as a DOC file
[ANNOTATION-611] Annotation.NET - Drawing options for area and polyline annotation tools
[ANNOTATION-612] Annotation.NET - Annotation tools control method
[ANNOTATION-613] Annotation.NET - Clickable annotations option
[ANNOTATION-614] Annotation.NET - Arrow drawing tool
[ANNOTATION-618] Annotation.NET - Show toolbar option
[ANNOTATION-621] Annotation.NET - Non-generic file name for a file with exported comments
[ANNOTATION-622] Annotation.NET - Text highligh color option
[ANNOTATION-623] Annotation.NET - Horizontal margins for document container on load
[ANNOTATION-624] Annotation.NET - Annotations clean up on document load
[ANNOTATION-627] Annotation.NET - Annotation activation on click inside its area
[ANNOTATION-628] Annotation.NET - Scroll content to invisible annotation when selected on the summary pane
[ANNOTATION-631] Annotation.NET - Highlighted text bounding rectangles storing
[ANNOTATION-607] Annotation.NET - Changes tracking support
[ANNOTATION-608] Annotation.NET - Scroll on focus option
[ANNOTATION-609] Annotation.NET - Connectors position option
[ANNOTATION-615] Annotation.NET - Disconnect uncommented annotations option
[ANNOTATION-616] Annotation.NET - File upload for annotations import
[ANNOTATION-617] Annotation.NET - Per-annotation drawing options storing
[ANNOTATION-636] Annotation.NET - Active annotation highlighting enhancement

Bugs fixed:

[ANNOTATION-537] Annotation.NET - Strikeout text is highlighted after the removing of strikeout
[ANNOTATION-574] Annotation.NET - Small issue is presented at header panel for user with out permissions for download and export
[ANNOTATION-569] Annotation.NET - Export does not work inside DNN plugin
[ANNOTATION-453] Annotation.NET - Annotation tools can not be moved
[ANNOTATION-586] Annotation.NET - SignalR requests fail in cross-domain environment
[ANNOTATION-595] Annotation.NET - The control fails to work in a virtual directory using a network drive as a file storage
[ANNOTATION-606] Annotation.NET - A wrong ison for the export to DOC menu item is displayed
[ANNOTATION-536] Annotation.NET - Annotation creation/removing broadcasting does not work
[ANNOTATION-605] Annotation.NET - A comment box and a connecting line are not created for newly added text replacement annotations
[ANNOTATION-619] Annotation.NET - Div tags are added instead of the carriege return when exporting annotations
[ANNOTATION-625] Annotation.NET - The connectors overlap annotations border
[ANNOTATION-585] Text selection is shifted for some documents
[ANNOTATION-633] Annotation.NET - MVC sample does not work with SQL Server CE database
[ANNOTATION-604] Annotation.NET - An MVC5 sample does not work for a customer
[ANNOTATION-639] Annotation.NET - Clicking on the replacement annotation header does not activate the annotation
[ANNOTATION-640] Annotataion.NET - Annotation pointer is not changed to active state for text replacement annotations
[ANNOTATION-532] Annotation.NET - Annotations in "Summary" tab are ordered by the time of adding
[ANNOTATION-547] Annotation.NET - RHS panel isn't open automatically after adding of annotation
[ANNOTATION-635] Annotation.NET - An error occurs when a document is opened from the file open dialog
[ANNOTATION-642] Marker is shifted for text strikeout annotations
[ANNOTATION-644] Annotation.NET - Arrow annotation is not updated on zoom in/out
[ANNOTATION-645] Annotation.NET - Graphics annotation has improper direction after page refresh
[ANNOTATION-637] Annotation.NET - Text selection is shifted
[ANNOTATION-638] Annotation.NET - Point, typewriter and watermark tools do not work in Webforms applications
[ANNOTATION-643] Annotation.NET - Stylesheet classes conflict with default bootstrap classes
summary: GroupDocs.Annotation for .NET is a flexible library that allows you to add document and image annotation capability to your web or mobile applications. Based on HTML5 technology, GroupDocs Annotation library supports more than 45 file formats, allowing end users to annotate documents and images of just about any common business format, including PDF and Microsoft Word documents, Excel spreadsheets, PowerPoint presentations, Visio diagrams, TIFF, JPEG, PNG images and many more.
title: GroupDocs.Annotation for .NET
